programme.title: Class of '92: Full Time
programme.desc: Expectations are high for Salford City, but with a new manager in place and a trip to Wembley on the horizon, the team are struggling to keep pace with the league leaders. (S4, ep 2)

programme.title: Class of '92: Full Time
programme.desc: Another departure in the dugout sends shockwaves through the club, and Salford begin the hunt for their fourth manager of the season. Can they maintain their promotion hopes? (S4, ep 3)

programme.title: Class of '92: Full Time
programme.desc: The Class of '92 begin their eighth season as owners of Salford City. After a bad start to the league campaign, the club turn to the transfer market to revitalise their promotion bid. Ep 1.

programme.title: Premier League Years 1995/96
programme.desc: Take a look back at all of the most memorable moments from the 1995-96 Premier League season, with classic music from the time, major news headlines and more.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games: Wolves/WBA '12
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the Premier League. Here, Black Country rivals Wolves and West Brom clash at Molineux back in 2012 in a memorable match for the Baggies.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Burnley/Man U 2009
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic Premier League match. Here, Burnley take on Manchester United at Turf Moor in August 2009 on what would be a memorable evening for the Clarets.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Cardiff/Man City 2013
programme.desc: Relive some classic action from the Premier League archive. Here, Cardiff meet Man City on a memorable afternoon in south Wales back in 2013.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Arsenal/Charlton 2001
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the Premier League. Here, Arsenal take on Charlton Athletic at Highbury back in 2001 on a memorable afternoon for the Addicks.

programme.title: Best Premier League Goals 92/93
programme.desc: Sky Sports takes a look at some of the best goals from Premier League seasons in years gone by. Here, some of the best goals from the Premier League's first season - the 92-93 campaign.

programme.title: PL 100 Club: Alan Shearer
programme.desc: A celebration of some of the finest goalscorers in Premier League history. This episode features the best of Alan Shearer's 260 top-flight goals. Tweet your favourite #pl100club

programme.title: Best PL Goals: Newcastle
programme.desc: Enjoy all of the best goals scored over the years by Newcastle United in the Premier League, including classic strikes by Alan Shearer, Laurent Robert and others.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Coventry/Man Utd 1997
programme.desc: A look at the greatest Premier League game for each club, as voted for by fans. Here, for Coventry City, the stunning late comeback 3-2 win over Manchester United back in December 1997.

programme.title: PL Greatest:Everton/Wimbledon 1994
programme.desc: Everton: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Everton, the 3-2 win over Wimbledon in 1994 that ensured the Toffees' survival.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Man City/Fulham 2008
programme.desc: Fulham: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Fulham, the 3-2 fightback at Man City in 2008 that ignited their survival run.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Arsenal/Hull '08
programme.desc: Hull: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Hull City, the famous 2-1 away win at Arsenal back in September 2008.

programme.title: Premier League Years 1996/97
programme.desc: Take a look at all the most memorable moments from the 1996-97 Premier League season, accompanied by hit music from the time, big news stories and more.

programme.title: PL Retro: Arsenal v Tottenham 2008
programme.desc: Relive on the greatest north London derbies of all time as Arsenal take on Tottenham Hotspur at the Emirates Stadium back in the 2008-09 season in a game with a remarkable conclusion.

programme.title: PL Stories: Seamus Coleman
programme.desc: From humble beginnings to becoming an Everton icon, we explore the story of Seamus Coleman - beloved by fans for his loyalty, leadership and fierce dedication.

programme.title: The Big Interview: Joe Aribo
programme.desc: Having traded Scotland for the Premier League, Southampton's Joe Aribo reflects on his new life on the south coast, his Nigerian Roots and growing up in the cages of south-east London.

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: With a long-awaited win secured, Southampton look to build momentum as Russell Martin's side take on fellow strugglers Wolves at Molineux. Just one point separates the two sides. (09.11)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Spurs host Sean Dyche's Everton in the Premier League. Tottenham's dominance only yielded a point at the King Power, while the Toffees were comprehensively beaten by Brighton. (24.08)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Spurs look to put an end to their slump as Ange Postecoglou's side face resurgent Wolves, who have made the perfect start under new boss Vitor Pereira with two wins from two. (29.12)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Bournemouth take an unwanted run of five Premier League games without a win to the London Stadium, as West Ham join the Cherries in search of a return to winning ways. (05.04)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Brighton play host to Tottenham at the Amex in the Premier League on Super Sunday. (06.10)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Winless in four now, Fabian Hurzeler's Brighton go to the London Stadium to face a West Ham side who were denied three points late on earlier this week away at Bournemouth. (21.12)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Chelsea look to respond after defeat at Brighton, as Enzo Maresca's side visit Villa Park on Saturday Night Football to play a Villa team fresh from a midweek clash with Liverpool. (22.02)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Still hunting for their first points of the season, Everton travel to Villa Park on Saturday Night Football. The Toffees haven't beaten Aston Villa in 10 Premier League attempts. (14.09)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Focus remains on the Champions League for Unai Emery's beaten quarter-finalists, as Villa host a Newcastle side with European ambitions of their own on Saturday Night Football. (19.04)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: On Saturday Night Football, Villa meet third-placed Forest. After a statement South Coast win, Unai Emery's Villa attempt to derail a Forest side closing in on Europe's top table. (05.04)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Wolves return to Molineux having registered back-to-back wins for the first time since February, as Gary O'Neil's side host Andoni Iraola's Bournemouth for a Premier League clash. (30.11)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: On Saturday Night Football, the race for Europe hits the South Coast as European hopefuls Bournemouth host top five-chasing Villa. Both sides come from crucial wins last weekend. (10.05)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Saturday Night Football comes from the Vitality Stadium, where European hopefuls Bournemouth welcome Thomas Frank's Brentford for a Premier League contest on the South Coast.

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Saturday Night Football comes from the Gtech Community Stadium, where Villa are the visitors as Unai Emery's men prepare to take on a Brentford side unbeaten in their last three. (08.03)

programme.title: MNF Special: Peter Schmeichel
programme.desc: Manchester United legend Peter Schmeichel explains the secrets to his success with this goalkeeping masterclass, from the importance of starting positions, to angles and coming out quickly.

programme.title: Paul McGrath: PFA Winner
programme.desc: Written off and in the grip of addiction; in a rare interview Paul McGrath recounts the extraordinary circumstances of the best season of his career.

programme.title: Les Ferdinand: PFA Winner
programme.desc: Les Ferdinand remembers a rollercoaster 1995-96 season, which saw him forge an unbreakable bond with the Newcastle supporters and ended with him being named PFA Players' Player of the Year.

programme.title: Transfer 360: Juninho
programme.desc: Find out the inside story of Juninho's move to Middlesbrough. Hear from Bryan Robson, ex-teammates and Juninho himself on how a Brazilian star ended up signing for a newly promoted club.

programme.title: Transfer 360: Jurgen Klinsmann
programme.desc: Find out the inside story of Jurgen Klinsmann's move to Spurs. Hear from Ossie Ardiles, Lord Sugar and Klinsmann himself on how his reputation changed, taking the Premier League by storm.

programme.title: Gary Neville's Soccerbox: Rooney
programme.desc: Gary Neville sits down with former teammate Wayne Rooney to chat through some of the most memorable matches from across their trophy-laden careers.

programme.title: Class of '92: Full Time
programme.desc: With a playoff place the minimum expectation, an unbeaten run of games has Salford close in on the top seven. But fan unrest prompts Gary Neville to make some big changes. Ep 2.

programme.title: Class of '92: Full Time
programme.desc: With wholesale changes over the summer, Salford's new manager has just five weeks of pre-season to transform the team ahead of another promotion push. Contains strong language. Ep 3.

programme.title: Class Of '92: Full Time
programme.desc: Class of '92-owned Salford City embark on their first season in the Football League - but the club are finding life in the new division tougher than expected. (S3, ep 1)

programme.title: Premier League Years 1997/98
programme.desc: Take a look back at all the memorable moments from the 1997-98 season, a season in which Alex Ferguson's Manchester United and Arsene Wenger's Arsenal had a titanic tussle for the title.

programme.desc: Ipswich: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Ipswich Town, the 3-2 win over Manchester United in September 1994.

programme.title: PL Greatest: M'boro/Man City 2008
programme.desc: Middlesbrough: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 49 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Middlesbrough, the 8-1 hammering of Man City back in May 2008.

programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic game from the Premier League. Here, Newcastle United enjoy a memorable afternoon at St James' Park as they rip apart Man Utd in a 5-0 destruction.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Man Utd/Norwich 2015
programme.desc: Norwich: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Norwich City, the 2-1 win over Manchester United in December 2015.

programme.desc: QPR: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For QPR, the 3-2 win over Liverpool that saw Rangers score three in the last 13 minutes.

programme.title: Cu Leis Thu? | A Puppy for Padruig
programme.desc: 5/6. Peter dons his wellies to learn about Scotland's favourite dog, the labrador retriever. Tha Pàdruig ag ionnsachadh mun chù as mòr-chòrdte an Alba - an Labrador.

programme.title: Eòrpa/European Current Affairs
programme.desc: 4/16. Anna MacLeod asks what the future holds for the Catholic Church under the stewardship of Pope Leo XIV.

programme.desc: Cuirm à Talla Rìoghail Ghlaschu le Sian agus sàr luchd-ciùil traidiseanta na dùthcha. Sian and some of Scotland's finest trad musicians perform at Glasgow Royal Concert Hall.

programme.title: An Clo Mor
programme.desc: 5/6. The community comes to terms with the aftermath of the fire, while Johan makes moves to become a majority shareholder in the mill.

programme.title: Larach Leabhar Dheir (The Missing Monastery)
programme.desc: An tòir air Mhanachainn Dhèir a' leantainn. The search for the Monastery of Deer continues.

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: Featuring unseen music performances from Rachel Walker & Aaron Jones and Duncan Chisholm.

programme.title: Alba Today

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh ùr bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: 51/52. Tha an innleachd ùr aig Cùlag ag adhbhrachadh trioblaid mhòr an-diugh. Cùlag's new invention causes a big problem.

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: 23/26. The Abadas are playing in the mud in the garden when Ben invites them to play another great word game. What will today's word be and who will be chosen to look for it?

programme.title: Cleasan Ataidh & Tilidh/The...
programme.desc: ...Adventures of Abney & Teal. 47/52. Neep gets himself into a sticky situation, copying tricks from the circus.

programme.title: Daolag-bhreac is Seillean/Ladybird & Bee
programme.desc: 6/26. Abair gu bheil rudan ag atharrachadh - ach càite bheil am burras? There's a lot changing, but where is the caterpillar?

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: 1/26. While out picking blackberries, Célestine finds an old mill covered in ivy. Ernest claims that the building is haunted. Instead of scaring Célestine, it piques her curiosity.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: 32/80. A bedtime story for young children. Iain MacInnes reads Measgaichte, written and illustrated by Arree Chung and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart.

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol...
programme.desc: ...Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud. 27/52. Dave makes a Gareth-shaped piñata for Gareth's birthday, but his starfish friend is confused when the Spuds bash it to pieces.

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol...
programme.desc: ...Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud. 28/52. School puts Dave on a work placement with his dad at the local dump.

programme.title: Uaine
programme.desc: 8/8. Tha Calum a' tadhal air Coimhearsnachd Findhorn a tha a' dèanamh an dìcheall a bhith cho uaine 's a ghabhas. Calum visits the Findhorn Community, which tries to be as green as possible.

programme.title: Hilda
programme.desc: 12/13. Tha turas campaidh gus bhith ann is tha Hilda is Flòraidh a' cur aithne air caraidean ùra. A camping trip is going to take place, and Hilda and Flòraidh make new acquaintances.

programme.title: Clann a' Chogaidh Mhoir (Small Hands in a Big War)
programme.desc: 6/8. Drama series telling the story of WWI as seen through the eyes of children. In this episode, a 12-year-old American girl and her parents flee the war in Europe.

programme.title: Celtic Connections
programme.desc: 6/11. Còmhlan folk-tradaiseanta à Canada a' cluich am port aca Before My Time. Canadian trio perform one of their tunes mixing traditional folk with a trance-folk beat.

programme.title: Am Madadh-Allaidh

programme.title: Trusadh - Air a' Mhachair/Life on the Machair
programme.desc: 2/10. Trusadh takes a tour of the Outer Hebrides to find out what life is like on the machair, visiting the communities that breathe life into this land.

programme.title: Fleabag
programme.desc: 1/6. Angry, pervy, outrageous and hilarious, Fleabag arrives with a bang. Contains very strong language and some scenes of a sexual nature.

programme.title: Fleabag
programme.desc: 2/6. Fleabag attempts to rekindle romantic fires to distract her from the mayhem of her life. Contains strong language and some scenes of a sexual nature.

programme.title: The Tooney and Russo Show
programme.desc: 1/10. A lot can happen in a break between recordings, so the trio wanted to update each other on everything that they've been up to since the last series.

programme.title: To Catch a Stalker
programme.desc: 1/2. Zara meets Isobel and Jen as they face terrifying real-world stalkers. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: To Catch a Stalker

programme.title: Such Brave Girls

programme.title: Such Brave Girls

programme.title: What It Feels Like for a Girl

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn: Behind The Deal

programme.title: Auction Hunters

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The Dallas Mavericks: Allen and Ton come up against Texas's most elite buyers as they discover a military-grade cruise missile jet engine and a Wild West saddle. (S2, ep 14)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Everything's Bigger in Texas: Allen and Ton uncover an 1886 rifle invented to kill buffalo. Then they head to the monster track to test 1950s electric slot cars. (S2, ep 13)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The Smoking Ton: Allen and Ton score a World War II Stuart M3 tank barrel and heavy-duty tank treads. In the ultimate deli unit, they discover a gigantic meat slicer. (S2, ep 12)

programme.title: Junk & Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole and his fellow Junketeers go all rural when they buy a tractor at an agricultural auction. (S2, ep 3)

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: UFOs: Why Are They Here?

programme.title: The Mystery Of The Holy Lance

programme.title: Nostradamus: 21st Century Prophecies Revealed
programme.desc: How did a Frenchman living in the 16th century predict so many modern-day disasters? This special explores how one person could see into the future.

programme.title: The Next Nostradamus
programme.desc: Dr Bueno de Mesquita claims to have an algorithm that predicts future events. Having already foreseen Al Qaeda's role in 9/11, it now predicts global disaster. Can we argue with maths?

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.title: New: SEX: A Bonkers History

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Harvest Day. Love Monster has to judge the Harvest Day talent contest, but there is only one prize and three teams, and he can't decide which of his friends deserves to win.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above & Beyond
programme.desc: Beetle Invasion. Calico Jack and Kwazii attempt to move bombardier beetles to a more hospitable island.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: How to Record Sound. On an exciting trip around planet Proxima, Cosima and Big Lizard record some cosmic nature sounds for Dad.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: A Clean Getaway. Supertato and Tomato find themselves stuck in a slippery bathtub, whilst Evil Pea rampages around the supermarket on a giant soap-squirting machine.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Moving Badge. Snail is thrilled to be moving house, and the Squirrels help her.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: The Tale of Old Brown's Feather. Animated series. When Peter takes one of Old Brown's tail feathers, a wild chase across the valley ensues to retrieve it and pacify the furious owl!

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Mission: Windy Day. It's a windy day in Woofton, and a famous local artist has gone missing. Dan and Jamie are called out on a day search.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Pow Tao. Tao asks Mojo and Bo to help him film an action-packed snowboarding video, but Mojo is not so steady on the slopes. Which top can they swap to grab the white-hot snow shots?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Wild Girls. Coco wants to play 'wild girls' with Indy, but Chloe wants her to try another game.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Handstand. At a party, Bingo is desperate to show off her handstand skills.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: My Fair Pancake. When the Emperor Penguin visits the berg, he discovers Pancake is a long-lost prince. Pancake learns how to act royal, but all the attention goes to his head.

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: School Run. Live-action children's show. It's the day before Topsy and Tim visit their new school for the first time. They are excited but wonder how they will travel there each day.

programme.title: Our Family Fun Shorts
programme.desc: Amanpreet's Bike Race. Super-speedy Amanpreet challenges her big sister Amrit to a race - but who will win?

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle and George. Preschool comedy drama series. Mrs Hobbs's cat George gets locked inside her house, giving Waffle a chance to prove himself to Mrs Hobbs. Can he rescue George?

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Mossy Impossible. Mossy? A hero?

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: It's Time to Meet a New Baby. JoJo and Gran Gran spend the day with Navid and his new baby, Akeel. JoJo realises she was once a baby too!

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Dibillo Visits the Bridge. Mr Onion is very pleased that his best friend Dibillo wants to visit his bridge for tea. Mr Onion waits patiently for his best friend - but where is Dibillo?

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Small's New Star. Stop-motion animation. The Iron Chicken dumps a huge bundle of junk metal on to the Clangers' planet. Major wants to keep it, but Small has an idea to transform it.

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Makka Pakka's Piles of Three. Children's programme. The Tombliboos are indoors playing with their bricks while Makka Pakka is making piles of stones, but he's missing a stone.

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Scott Mills - What Makes a Lemur Listen. Join BBC Radio 2 DJ Scott Mills for a story about a lovable lemur who learns to listen.

programme.title: Oasis: Supersonic
programme.desc: (2016) Acclaimed music documentary. Noel and Liam Gallagher try to remember where they were while they were getting high during Oasis's chaotic journey to superstardom in the 1990s.

programme.title: F1 British GP Qualifying...
programme.desc: ...Highlights: Russell claimed pole at his home GP last year. More recently, Norris got P1 in Austria. Then there's that other guy... you know... Lewis Hamilton. Bring it on at Silverstone.

programme.title: Joram
programme.desc: (2023) Gritty crime thriller. A tribal migrant goes on the run with his baby after his wife is brutally murdered. But a Mumbai cop is on his trail. In Hindi/subs.

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca Gaines, Rebecca Loses Part 1: Rebecca impresses Kelly's father and is thrilled when he invites her over to his house, but the evening isn't what she was expecting.

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: G.I. (Annoyed Grunt): Homer accidentally signs up for basic training in the army. And Marge and Grampa get roped in when they try to get him released.

programme.desc: Hungry Hungry Homer: Homer goes on hunger strike when he discovers that the Springfield Isotopes baseball team are planning to move to Albuquerque.

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Live: F1 British Grand Prix

programme.desc: A gripping forensic account of the manhunt across London after the 7/7 terror bombings of 2005, and the police killing of innocent bystander Jean Charles de Menezes. (Ep1/2)

programme.desc: Will We Die?: Series finale of the comedy with Rosie Jones. Emily and Ewen realise that the net's closing in and everyone's onto them. Can the gang find a way out of the drugs game? (Ep6/6)

programme.title: Grand Designs

programme.desc: Goodbye Nome. The weather is warming fast as the ice season closes and the miners rush to secure their futures. On the Clark, Zeke's hunt for a paystreak has him at breaking point. S5, Ep24

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Uncharted Waters. As the new summer mining season begins, gold in Nome is drying up, pushing miners to extreme new locations in a desperate search for gold. S6, Ep1

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Back To The Killing Season. Sig returns to the season that nearly killed him. After a tough start, Keith and son fight to prove themselves. Plus, Wild Bill gives Nick another chance. S13, Ep10

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Hurricane Alley. When the Arctic unleashes its winter wrath, the first of several hurricanes descend on the fleet. Patchy fishing and mutiny converge to create the perfect storm. S13, Ep11

programme.title: Building Alaska
programme.desc: This Was A Rough One. The Owens work to finish the roof but whiteout conditions make the job perilous. Jackie's team struggles to lift the 250-lb stove up to the cabin. S10, Ep5

programme.title: Building Off The Grid
programme.desc: Tropical Paradise. A couple is building an oceanfront family oasis on the slopes of Maui, Hawaii. They design a budget-friendly Quonset hut, but they're hit by unexpected setbacks. S4, Ep7

programme.title: Building Off The Grid
programme.desc: Georgia Mountain Treehouse. A young couple sets out to create their dream treehouse retreat in Northern Georgia overlooking the breath-taking Blue Ridge Mountains. S1, Ep1

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto's Surprise. Jane and Charlotte trek through bear country to protect their herd. Three generations of Kilchers build a shack on Perl Island and Otto has a surprise for Charlotte. S9, Ep6

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Moving Mountains. Things get explosive when the Kilchers expand a road with the help of a detonation expert. Atz Sr and Bonnie brave the backcountry to salvage vital resources. S9, Ep7

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Sweet Homestead Alabama. For families moving entirely off-grid, the learning curve is steep. To save their homesteads, they call in survival experts to prepare them for the worst. S4, Ep3

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen discover a hidden shaft by falling straight down into it. The Young Guns are forced to undertake emergency repairs halfway down a mine shaft. S5, Ep15

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen take over their new recruit's mine, but the new claim proves equally treacherous with little sign of opal. Bishop resorts to explosives to move a wall. S5, Ep16

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Bite the Hand. A second major storm hits the fleet. While rookie skipper Jake Anderson reaches out to Sig Hansen for help, Josh Harris arrives on the grounds weeks late. S11, Ep14

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: New Blood, Old Wounds. Late into Opilio season, the fleet battles against mental & physical breakdown. After deliberately defying Sig, Captain Jake Anderson has a shot at redemption. S11, Ep15

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Mining On A Prayer. Kris must move fast in the face of a life-threatening incident. Vernon pushes a diver for a personal record, and Shawn deals with a crack in the ice. S10, Ep29

programme.desc: Legend Vs. Underdog. A massive blizzard is about to hit Nome, Alaska, and bring the mining season to an end. Zeke risks one last move, while Shawn hits a big jackpot. S10, Ep30

programme.desc: The Fermentation Bifurcation: The gang run into Penny's ex-boyfriend, Zack, at a wine bar. Bernadette, who can't drink, hangs out with Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Line Substitution Solution: Sheldon pays Stuart to spend the afternoon shopping with Amy so that he can queue up to see a special film screening instead.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Convergence Convergence: Conflict arises when Leonard's recently divorced parents and Sheldon's devoutly religious mother are all in town at the same time.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Baby Shower and Testosterone-Rich Banter: Mary butts heads with Mandy's mother, and Sheldon attempts male bonding.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Frat Party, a Sleepover and the Mother of All Blisters: Paige drags Sheldon to a college party, and Missy gets caught in a lie.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A Tale of Three Cities: There's a reunion after trips took the Dunphys to New York; Mitch, Cam and Lily to the Midwest; and Jay, Gloria, Manny and Joe to Juarez in Mexico.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A Stereotypical Day: Jay goes out of his way to make a good impression on the new neighbours.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Dad Who Knew Too Little: Homer hires a detective to spy on Lisa so he can get to know her better. But when Homer doesn't pay him, the detective frames Lisa for a crime.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pray Anything: Jealous of Flanders' lifestyle, Homer starts to pray for material possessions, but things get out of hand when he asks for a bigger house and gets the church.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Romance Recalibration: Penny thinks that Leonard has stopped making an effort in their relationship, so she decides to go away for a spa weekend with Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Emotion Detection Automation: Sheldon tests a new invention after hearing that it could help him to read people's emotions. Raj seeks dating advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotion Reverberation: Leonard and Howard distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows their progress on the guidance system.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse of Sand and Fog: Milhouse is annoyed when his parents get back together. Homer catches chicken pox.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A shocking call reveals that a former resident is behind bars, while Rex faces a chilling ultimatum. Dillon takes courageous steps. And will a secret fling come to light?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Strong Arms of the Ma: When Marge is mugged, she reacts by working out with weights, but goes too far and ends up as a steroid-crazed bully.

programme.title: New: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Brand new series - New Kid on the Dock: The arrival of a new stew brings mixed reactions from the crew. A deckhand is blindsided by bad news from home. Aesha's frustration peaks.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, The Great British Bake Off, The Crown, Family Fortunes, Love Is Blind, Mammals and This Morning.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching The Crown, I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, You Won't Believe This, Down to Earth with Zac Efron, and The Hidden Lives of Pets.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
programme.desc: (2018) Finale to the dystopian sci-fi action saga. As the Flare virus ravages the planet, the WCKD organisation experiments on children to find a cure. Can the Gladers save them?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (2010) Remake of the classic martial arts film, starring Jackie Chan and Jaden Smith. A caretaker shows an American boy how to stand up to bullies at his new school in Beijing.

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy sequel with Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller and Jessica Alba. Can Greg Focker live up to nightmare dad-in-law Jack's newfound reluctant sort-of respect?

programme.title: Funny Cow
programme.desc: (2017) Gritty comedy-drama starring Maxine Peake as a female comedian navigating the working men's clubs of 1970s northern England.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Life in Lockdown
programme.desc: Six members of the deaf community recall the fear that gripped Britain during the Covid-19 crisis, and give us an insight into how the pandemic and lockdown affected their lives.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: (1965) William Whitney's brutal western. Two former Confederate rebels are offered their freedom if they can track, catch or even kill their former gang mates. Starring Audie Murphy.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: (1949) Drama with John Ireland. A local politician begins to lust for the kind of power he used to hold to account. He should be careful how he treats people on the way to the top...

programme.title: A Kid for Two Farthings
programme.desc: (1955) Carol Reed's charming film stars Jonathan Ashmore as a young, impressionable boy who mistakes a one-horned goat for a unicorn in London's colourful Petticoat Lane market.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: True History of the Kelly Gang
programme.desc: (2019) Intense fictional account of 19th-century bushman Ned Kelly's (George MacKay) journey into crime and life on the run. With Russell Crowe. Very strong language/violence throughout.

programme.title: Utama
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant drama about a couple being driven out from their lifelong home in the mountain plateaus of Bolivia by drought. In Quechua/Spanish, subs. Upestting scenes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: The Man Between
programme.desc: (1953) Atmospheric thriller set in post-war Berlin, where Ivo Kern (James Mason) and Susanne Mallison (Claire Bloom) get caught up in a maelstrom of bigamy, blackmail and bullets.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: The Madness of King George
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning drama with Nigel Hawthorne and Ian Holm. In 1788, King George III starts exhibiting signs of mental illness and is forced to endure barbaric 'cures'.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost...
programme.desc: ...Protocol: (2011) Part four of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The Impossible Missions Force fight to clear their name, while also trying to avert nuclear war. Busy, busy, busy!

programme.title: American Refugee
programme.desc: (2021) Tense survival thriller that opens with news of the American economy tanking, oil prices plummeting, supply chains being disrupted and borders closing causing people to panic...

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
programme.desc: (2018) Finale to the dystopian sci-fi action saga. As the Flare virus ravages the planet, the WCKD organisation experiments on children to find a cure. Can the Gladers save them?

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the first stage of the race, a 184.9km route around Lille. This is the 112th edition of the world's most famous cycling event which originally started in 1903. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart. Pampered pooch Max is forced into drastic action when his owner brings home a rescue mongrel to share their Manhattan apartment.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Eddie Kadi to try disco yoga, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a community fundraiser, and Heidi Phillip-Smith demonstrates more latte art

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined for a chat by Danny Jones of McFly and actress Maureen Lipman, while horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith and carpenter Wayne Perrey join forces to help bring bees back to gardens. Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner return with the cookery show, kicking things off with a back-to-basics masterclass for four favourite dishes. They start with tagliata steak with a butterbean mash, before moving on to crispy fried Thai-style bream with a butter lettuce salad. Then it's an aubergine parmigiana schnitzel that is hearty and comforting, and Lisa's summer strawberry sponge with fresh strawberries and piped cream that is the perfect summer showstopper

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan answers a viewer's gardening question, Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a spectacular coastal garden, Claire Lowrie shares advice on summer-proofing houseplants, and Katy Watson reveals how to plant smartly for both droughts and downpours

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the garden makeover team head to Chippenham, Wiltshire to create a traditional formal garden for an inspirational couple. Richard Warren has been a serving Special Constable for 52 years, and dedicates his spare time to running marathons to raise money for charity, and caring for his wife Lynette, who has multiple sclerosis. The team shares tips on how to create a formal pond from scratch, screening solutions for unsightly spots in the garden, and reveals how to mark out a perfectly oval lawn

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: Oscar-winning spy adventure starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger and Adolfo Celi. A Nato aircraft has been stolen by criminal organisation Spectre and the world is threatened by its nuclear payload. Agent 007 is assigned to the case and the trail leads to the Bahamas and the sinister Emilio Largo.

programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to Islay and gets a lesson in peat cutting, learns about creating a sustainable future, finds out about creating habitat for the corncrake and receives a much-needed golf lesson

programme.desc: Reporters travel around the country to find amazing stories from Scotland's past

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Switzerland v Iceland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents coverage of both teams' second Group A match, which comes from Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. The sides were also in the same group in this year's Nations League and the teams could not be separated in their two meetings, drawing 0-0 in Zurich before playing out a 3-3 thriller in Reykjavik, with Iceland forward Karólína Lea Vilhjálmsdóttir scoring a hat-trick to help her nation fight back from 3-1 down. Both teams lost their opening contest, with the hosts taking the lead against Norway, but losing 2-1, and Iceland having Hildur Antonsdottir sent off in a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Finland

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Remake of the classic western starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt and Ethan Hawke. When a ruthless land baron sets about persecuting the residents of a small town, a young widow turns to bounty hunter Sam Chisolm for aid. But he's going to need a little help if he is to restore order.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Charlene White, Russell Kane and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Cardiff mates Tom and Luke, London couple Milo and Bim, and friends Jan and Jackie from Dorset use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray asks the questions

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Belgium (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' second match in Group B, held at Arena Thun in Switzerland. The teams met twice earlier this year in the UEFA Nations League, with Belgium nearly causing an upset in Valencia, only for the world champions to score twice in second-half stoppage time to claim a 3-2 win. The second meeting in Leuven was considerably more comfortable for Spain, as they romped to a 5-1 win. Spain's status as favourites to win the tournament was further reinforced when they prevailed 5-0 against Portugal in their opener, and Belgium lost their first match 1-0 to Italy

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Portugal v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of the second match in Group B for both teams, held at Stade de Genève in Switzerland. After losing their opener to Spain, Portugal have now gone six matches without a win and will be eliminated from the competition should they lose and the Spanish have earned at least a point against Belgium. The Italians on the other hand went into the competition on the back of an encouraging UEFA Nations League campaign that saw them finish second in their group below Sweden and ahead of Denmark and Wales, and they won their first match of the tournament 1-0 against the Belgians

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: A look at the case of American influencer Alexis Sharkey, who was declared missing in November 2020 by her husband Thomas Sharkey. When her body was found on a side road by a truck driver shortly after, detectives began an investigation that led to her spouse. However, just two weeks after the body was found, he also disappeared without trace

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage three, a flat 178.3km route from Valenciennes to Dunkerque. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett and Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: .The suspects return home and attempt to patch their lives back together, while a surprising connection is revealed. Katherine Newman finds her chances of becoming the US ambassador under threat, and a scapegoat is urgently required to defuse the growing scandal. Psychological thriller, starring Kunal Nayyar, Georgina Campbell, Elyes Gabel, Elizabeth Henstridge and Angel Coulby

programme.desc: Dermot heads to cosmopolitan Cork, a port city renowned for its food and produce. Dermot's begins his culinary adventure at the curiously named English Market, where he samples cheese and spiced beef, a kind of pastrami unique to the city

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up the ultimate ham sandwich, enjoys a delicious Spanish recipe for turbot from chef Jose Pizarro, shows how to make a classic sole meunière in another masterclass. He also treats singer Gabrielle to a Thai green curry that he makes with a little help from chefs Richard Corrigan and Nick Nairn

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Married Londoners Pete and Matt, Hertfordshire mother and daughter Debbie and Taylor, and new parents Charly and Marcus from Essex use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe is knocked unconscious by an assailant, while Charity worries for a fragile post-op Sarah, and Kim braces herself to tell Dawn that she has got a new man

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the fourth stage, a hilly 174.2km route between Amiens and Rouen. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and his mum Penny, Tony Bellew and his son Corey, and Vicky Pattison and her mum Carroll compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romesh's mum Shanthi's method for getting away with murder

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe is knocked unconscious by an assailant, while Charity worries for a fragile post-op Sarah, and Kim braces herself to tell Dawn that she has got a new man

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the fourth stage, a hilly 174.2km route between Amiens and Rouen. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the first stage of the race, a 184.9km route around Lille. This is the 112th edition of the world's most famous cycling event which originally started in 1903. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart. Pampered pooch Max is forced into drastic action when his owner brings home a rescue mongrel to share their Manhattan apartment.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Eddie Kadi to try disco yoga, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a community fundraiser, and Heidi Phillip-Smith demonstrates more latte art

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined for a chat by Danny Jones of McFly and actress Maureen Lipman, while horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith and carpenter Wayne Perrey join forces to help bring bees back to gardens. Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner return with the cookery show, kicking things off with a back-to-basics masterclass for four favourite dishes. They start with tagliata steak with a butterbean mash, before moving on to crispy fried Thai-style bream with a butter lettuce salad. Then it's an aubergine parmigiana schnitzel that is hearty and comforting, and Lisa's summer strawberry sponge with fresh strawberries and piped cream that is the perfect summer showstopper

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan answers a viewer's gardening question, Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a spectacular coastal garden, Claire Lowrie shares advice on summer-proofing houseplants, and Katy Watson reveals how to plant smartly for both droughts and downpours

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the garden makeover team head to Chippenham, Wiltshire to create a traditional formal garden for an inspirational couple. Richard Warren has been a serving Special Constable for 52 years, and dedicates his spare time to running marathons to raise money for charity, and caring for his wife Lynette, who has multiple sclerosis. The team shares tips on how to create a formal pond from scratch, screening solutions for unsightly spots in the garden, and reveals how to mark out a perfectly oval lawn

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: Oscar-winning spy adventure starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger and Adolfo Celi. A Nato aircraft has been stolen by criminal organisation Spectre and the world is threatened by its nuclear payload. Agent 007 is assigned to the case and the trail leads to the Bahamas and the sinister Emilio Largo.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to Islay and gets a lesson in peat cutting, learns about creating a sustainable future, finds out about creating habitat for the corncrake and receives a much-needed golf lesson

programme.title: Scotland Revealed Moments
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge presents views of Stirling's landscape and landmarks from the air, and looks at the role the city played in the history of Scotland

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Reporters travel around the country to find amazing stories from Scotland's past

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Switzerland v Iceland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents coverage of both teams' second Group A match, which comes from Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. The sides were also in the same group in this year's Nations League and the teams could not be separated in their two meetings, drawing 0-0 in Zurich before playing out a 3-3 thriller in Reykjavik, with Iceland forward Karólína Lea Vilhjálmsdóttir scoring a hat-trick to help her nation fight back from 3-1 down. Both teams lost their opening contest, with the hosts taking the lead against Norway, but losing 2-1, and Iceland having Hildur Antonsdottir sent off in a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Finland

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Remake of the classic western starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt and Ethan Hawke. When a ruthless land baron sets about persecuting the residents of a small town, a young widow turns to bounty hunter Sam Chisolm for aid. But he's going to need a little help if he is to restore order.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Charlene White, Russell Kane and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Cardiff mates Tom and Luke, London couple Milo and Bim, and friends Jan and Jackie from Dorset use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray asks the questions

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Belgium (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' second match in Group B, held at Arena Thun in Switzerland. The teams met twice earlier this year in the UEFA Nations League, with Belgium nearly causing an upset in Valencia, only for the world champions to score twice in second-half stoppage time to claim a 3-2 win. The second meeting in Leuven was considerably more comfortable for Spain, as they romped to a 5-1 win. Spain's status as favourites to win the tournament was further reinforced when they prevailed 5-0 against Portugal in their opener, and Belgium lost their first match 1-0 to Italy

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Portugal v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of the second match in Group B for both teams, held at Stade de Genève in Switzerland. After losing their opener to Spain, Portugal have now gone six matches without a win and will be eliminated from the competition should they lose and the Spanish have earned at least a point against Belgium. The Italians on the other hand went into the competition on the back of an encouraging UEFA Nations League campaign that saw them finish second in their group below Sweden and ahead of Denmark and Wales, and they won their first match of the tournament 1-0 against the Belgians

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: A look at the case of American influencer Alexis Sharkey, who was declared missing in November 2020 by her husband Thomas Sharkey. When her body was found on a side road by a truck driver shortly after, detectives began an investigation that led to her spouse. However, just two weeks after the body was found, he also disappeared without trace

programme.desc: Action from stage three, a flat 178.3km route from Valenciennes to Dunkerque. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett and Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.desc: .The suspects return home and attempt to patch their lives back together, while a surprising connection is revealed. Psychological thriller, starring Kunal Nayyar, Georgina Campbell, Elyes Gabel, Elizabeth Henstridge and Angel Coulby

He also treats singer Gabrielle to a Thai green curry that he makes with a little help from chefs Richard Corrigan and Nick Nairn

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Married Londoners Pete and Matt, Hertfordshire mother and daughter Debbie and Taylor, and new parents Charly and Marcus from Essex use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe is knocked unconscious by an assailant, while Charity worries for a fragile post-op Sarah, and Kim braces herself to tell Dawn that she has got a new man

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the fourth stage, a hilly 174.2km route between Amiens and Rouen. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell
